Frustum of a cone

  1. Volume of the frustum of the cone = \(\frac {\pi}3 \times H \times [r^2 + R^2 + rR] \) where R, r are the radius of the circular parts of the frustum and H is the vertical height of the frustum.
  2. The curved surface area of the frustum of the cone = \(\pi \times l \times [r+R] \) where \(l=\sqrt {h^2+(R^2-r^2)}\).
  3. Total surface area of the frustum of the cone = CSA of the frustum + area of the base and top of the frustum= \(\pi \times l \times [r+R] + \pi \times (r^2+R^2)\) where \(l=\sqrt {h^2+(R^2-r^2)}\).
